articles.title: 2024 Pixel Buyer’s Guide: Which is the right Google phone for you? [Video] - 9to5Google
articles.summary: It’s that time of year when people might be looking to upgrade their phones. In 2024, we had 5 brand new Google Pixel phones to contend withplus the previous generations sticking aroundbut how do you… [+9936 chars]
articles.full_content:
It’s that time of year when people might be looking to upgrade their phones. In 2024, we had 5 brand new Google Pixel phones to contend with—plus the previous generations sticking around—but how do you decide which is right for you? Here’s everything you need to know.

As 2024 steadily comes to a close, Google’s Pixel 8a, Pixel 9, 9 Pro, 9 Pro XL, and 9 Pro Fold take up substantial space on the firm’s digital storefront. The pricing structure has evolved, and the lineup has improved, but there are key differences that help separate each device.

The Pixel 8a has one foot in the previous generation. It’s bubbly, rounded, and shares more of its DNA with the Pixel 8 and 8 Pro. The Pixel 9, 9 Pro, 9 Pro XL, and 9 Pro Fold are going to be the flagbearers from 2024 until – hopefully – late 2025.

What size smartphone do you want?

The easiest way to determine which Pixel you should buy in 2024 is to determine what size phone you want. If you want a smaller phone, you will also need to work out what display size you are happy with.

While the Pixel 8a has the smallest 6.1-inch display in 2024, its dimensions are very similar to those of the Pixel 9 and the 9 Pro. Larger bezels and a mostly plastic chassis also make the 8a around 10g lighter than the base Pixel 9 and 9 Pro. It might not seem like much, but once you put a case and screen protector on your device, it adds up.

Another consideration is the shape. Because the Pixel 8a is based on last year’s flagship phones, it has rounded corners and a bubbly aesthetic. The 9 series has adopted a boxier shape, which means flat sides with sharper edges. Also, the camera bar looks different. Does that matter? Well, that is ultimately up to you.

Pixel 8a Pixel 9 Pixel 9 Pro Pixel 9 Pro XL Pixel 9 Pro Fold Size 6.1-inches 6.3-inches* 6.3-inches 6.8-inches Closed: 6.3-inches

Open: 8-inches Resolution 1080 x 2400 pixels 1080 x 2424 pixels 1280 x 2856 pixels 1344 x 2992 pixels Outer: 1080 x 2424 pixels

Inner: 2076 x 2152 pixels Refresh rate 120Hz 120Hz 120Hz 120Hz 120Hz Dimensions 152.1 x 72.7 x 8.9mm (5.99 x 2.86 x 0.35in) 152.8 x 72 x 8.5mm (6.02 x 2.83 x 0.33in) 152.8 x 72 x 8.5mm (6.02 x 2.83 x 0.33in) 162.8 x 76.6 x 8.5mm (6.41 x 3.02 x 0.33in)

Closed: 155.2 x 77.1 x 10.5mm

Open: 155.2 x 150.2 x 5.1mm Weight 188g (6.63oz) 198g (6.98oz) 199g (7.02oz) 221g (7.80oz) 257g (9.07oz)

Choosing between the Pixel 9 and 9 Pro is less straightforward. This is the first time that Google has made two devices with identical dimensions. They technically have the exact same screen sizes. Realistically, the 9 has a slightly smaller screen because it has slightly larger screen bezels by just a fraction of a millimeter.

The upside if that, finally, we have a “Pro” tier phone that is small and doesn’t lose out on camera hardware and features. The Pixel 9 Pro is new for 2024 and comes with all of the same core internals as the Pixel 9 Pro XL. So, you can have the “best of Pixel” but in a smaller package. It does have a smaller battery to account for the diminished dimensions.

If you want a dual-purpose phone, the Pixel Fold has the largest 8-inch internal screen. The outer screen is actually the same size as the Pixel 9 and 9 Pro—at 6.3 inches. However, the biggest phone is the Pixel 9 Pro XL. This is the biggest Pixel to date in size and stature and has all of the best hardware to boot.

What specifications do you need?

Sometimes, the base model is more than enough for most people, and getting something with insane specifications can be overkill. Credit to Google this year; there is less confusion based on specs for 2024 Pixel phones.

If you are content with a smooth experience and don’t care about tons of storage options or raw power, the Pixel 8a may have last year’s processor and less RAM, but it will be a solid performer. The performance uplift from Tensor G3 to G4 is very minimal too.

Pixel 8a Pixel 9 Pixel 9 Pro Pixel 9 Pro XL Pixel 9 Pro Fold Processor Tensor G3 Tensor G4 Tensor G4 Tensor G4 Tensor G4 Memory 8GB 12GB 16GB 16GB 16GB Storage 128 / 256GB 128 / 256GB 128 / 256 / 512 / 1TB 128 / 256 / 512 / 1TB 256 / 512GB

The Pixel 9 is the entry-level model in the 9 series for 2024. It offers fewer storage options and 4GB less RAM, which could make it worse for specific AI-related tasks. That said, with the launch of Android 15, performance is practically identical to that of the Pixel 9 Pro, Pro XL, and Pro Fold.

If you need or want the most storage, you have two options: Pixel 9 Pro or 9 Pro XL. These phones have a unique 1TB storage variant that is unavailable on all other models.

What do you want from a camera system?

Google has always offered a competitive and compelling camera system on Pixel phones. They are lauded and loved for the unique characteristics of images – and now video. At the low end, the Pixel 8a is objectively the least capable Google camera system for 2024. The combination of a smaller main sensor and lower-resolution ultra-wide make it a great basic point-and-shoot smartphone.

What’s interesting is that the Pixel 9 Pro Fold utilizes the same main sensor and the same ultra-wide-angle lens as part of its camera array. Because it has a dedicated 5x telephoto zoom lens, it can be more flexible than the base Pixel 9.

The Pixel 9 ships with a dual lens system at the rear. It consists of the same main sensor and ultra-wide as the Pixel 9 Pro and Pro XL. Unfortunately, the selfie camera is lower resolution at 10.5MP, but still supports Face Unlock.

At the top of the totem for 2024 you’ll find the Pixel 9 Pro and Pro XL. The duo sport the exact same setup. A 50MP main sensor, 48MP ultrawide, improved 48MP 5x telephoto plus a new 42MP selfie camera for better front-facing photos and videos. If you want the “complete” camera experience the Pixel 9 Pro and Pro XL are essential.

Only these two devices are capable of recording 8K video with Video Boost. They also have enhanced zoom capabilities up to 30x and better zoom video at up to 20x. There are Pro modes here, too, for enhanced manual controls.

TL;DR – Which Pixel device should I choose?

Compared to last year, Google has really up the pricing for Pixel phones in 2024. The cheapest device released this year starts at $500. Sure, discounts can bring the Pixel 8a as low as $399, but when you consider that the Pixel 8 is a better version of the A-series handset and is cheaper than ever, I would look at that unit.

The Pixel 9 now starts at $799, a $100 jump. You get an overall better smartphone, but at $200 more, the Pixel 9 Pro is a far better buy if you can stomach the further $200 uptick. Make no mistake $999 is expensive, but it is one of the few small flagship phones you can buy that doesn’t have clipped wings.

Pixel 8a Pixel 9 Pixel 9 Pro Pixel 9 Pro XL Pixel 9 Pro Fold Price $499 / £499 / €549 $799 / £799 / €849 $999 / £999 / €1,099 $1,099 / £1,099 / €1, 149 $1,799 / £1,749 / €1,899

Another thing to note is that the Pixel 9 Pro XL is a whopping $1,099 this time around for the base 128GB variant. In global regions, it’s even more expensive and, a little like the 9 Pro, is harder to recommend at the base retail pricing.

On the other hand, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold is not going to be the best device for most people. It’s almost $2,000 and while it has the benefits of a dual-purpose form factor, there are downgrades that might not be worth it for most people.

If you don’t want to buy the latest devices, you’re not limited to the 2024 Pixel launch cohort. Google still offers the Pixel 8, 8 Pro, and Pixel 7a directly from the firm’s official store. These can be purchased at significant discounts and still offer extensive support windows and impressive functions. You’ll miss out on some AI goodies, but the core Android experience is practically unchanged.

If you are unsure which device is right for you, you can use the great built-in comparison tool on the Google Store. It’ll give you some key information to help streamline the buying decision.

You can pick up the Pixel 9 series at Amazon, Best Buy, Google Store, Walmart, and many more.

articles.title: SpaceX launches 24 more Starlink satellites from Florida - Space.com
articles.summary:
SpaceX just launched yet another batch of its Starlink internet satellites from Florida's Space Coast.
A Falcon 9 rocket carrying 24 Starlink spacecraft lifted off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center o… [+1727 chars]
articles.full_content:
SpaceX just notched a big spaceflight milestone.

A Falcon 9 rocket carrying 24 of the company's Starlink satellites lifted off from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Tuesday (Nov. 26) at 11:41 p.m. EST (0441 GMT on Wednesday, Nov. 27).

The satellites were deployed into low Earth orbit about 65 minutes later as planned. It was the 400th successful mission for the workhorse rocket, which debuted in 2010, SpaceX announced via X on Wednesday (Nov. 27).

A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket launches 24 Starlink internet satellites to orbit from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Nov. 26, 2024. It was the 400th successful Falcon 9 mission. (Image credit: SpaceX)

The Falcon 9's first stage came back to Earth safely, touching down on the droneship "A Shortfall of Gravitas" in the Atlantic Ocean about eight minutes after liftoff.

It was the 375th landing for a Falcon first stage overall, SpaceX said via X, and the 15th for this particular booster, according to a company mission description. Eleven of its 15 flights to date have been Starlink missions.

The first stage of a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket comes down for a landing on the deck of a drone ship shortly after launching 24 of the company’s Starlink internet satellites to orbit on Nov. 26, 2024. (Image credit: SpaceX)

SpaceX has now launched 117 Falcon 9 missions so far in 2024, and 81 of them have been devoted to building out the Starlink network. Five of those Starlink flights have occurred in the past eight days.

The Starlink megaconstellation — the biggest ever assembled — currently consists of nearly 6,700 active spacecraft, according to satellite tracker and astrophysicist Jonathan McDowell.

articles.title: ‘Delete CFPB’: Musk calls for elimination of consumer bureau - POLITICO
Sean 'Diddy' Combs denied bail as judge declares hip-hop mogul poses serious danger - ABC News
What fossilized dino feces can tell us about their rise to dominance - Ars Technica
articles.full_content:
Paleontologists have long puzzled over how the dinosaurs—originally relatively small and of minor importance to the broader ecosystem—evolved to become the dominant species some 30 million years later. Fossilized feces and vomit from dinosaurs might hold important clues to how and why this evolutionary milestone came about, according to a new paper published in the journal Nature.

Co-author Martin Qvarnström, an evolutionary biologist with Uppsala University in Sweden, and his collaborators studied trace fossils known as bromalites, a designation that includes coprolites as well as vomit or other fossilized matter from an organism's digestive tract. As previously reported, coprolites aren't quite the same as paleofeces, which retain a lot of organic components that can be reconstituted and analyzed for chemical properties. Coprolites are fossils, so most organic components have been replaced by mineral deposits like silicate and calcium carbonates.

For archaeologists keen on learning more about the health and diet of past populations—as well as how certain parasites evolved in the evolutionary history of the microbiome—coprolites and paleofeces can be a veritable goldmine of information. For instance, in 2021 we reported on an analysis of preserved paleo-poop revealing that ancient Iron Age miners in what is now Austria were fond of beer and blue cheese.

If a coprolite contains bone fragments, chances are the animal who excreted it was a carnivore, and tooth marks on those fragments can tell us something about how the animal may have eaten its prey. The size and shape of coprolites can also yield useful insights. If a coprolite is spiral-shaped, for instance, it might have been excreted by an ancient shark, since some modern fish (like sharks) have spiral-shaped intestines.

A tale of two models

Excavations in the Late Triassic locality at Lisowice, Poland. The site yielded a large number of coprolites of predators and herbivores. Credit: Krystian Balanda

Qvarnström et al. were keen to test two competing hypotheses about the dinosaurs' rise to dominance from the Late Triassic Period (237 million to 201 million years ago) to the onset of the Jurassic Period between 201 million to 145 million years ago. "No single hypothesis seems capable of explaining the rise of dinosaurs fully and critical questions about how dinosaurs established their dynasty on land remain largely unanswered," the authors wrote about their research objectives.

One hypothesis cites evolutionary competition—the traditional "competitive replacement" model—as a driving factor, in which dinosaurs were better equipped to survive thanks to superior physiologies, anatomical adaptations, and feeding habits. Alternatively the "opportunistic replacement" model suggests that the dinosaurs were better able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment brought about by random processes—volcanic eruptions, climate change, or other catastrophic events that led to the decline and/or extinction of other species.
